yogasaṃnyastakarmāṇaṃ jñānasañchinnasaṃśayam .
ātmavantaṃ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya ..4-41..
verses.desc:
41. He who has renounced actions by YOGA, whose doubts are rent asunder by
'Knowledge, ' who is self-possessed, actions do not bind him, O Dhananjaya.

verses.hn:
तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः |
छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ||४-४२||
verses.en:
tasmādajñānasambhūtaṃ hṛtsthaṃ jñānāsinātmanaḥ .
chittvainaṃ saṃśayaṃ yogamātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata ..4-42..
verses.desc:
42. Therefore with the sword-of-Knowledge, cut asunder the doubt-of-the-Self, born of
'ignorance, ' residing in your heart, and take refuge in "YOGA. " Arise, O Bharata.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
ज्ञानकर्मसंन्यासयोगो नाम चतुर्थोऽध्यायः ||४||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde jñānakarmasaṃnyāsayogo nāma caturtho.adhyāyaḥ ..4-43..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the fourth discourse ends entitled:
THE YOGA OF RENUNCIATION OF ACTION IN KNOWLEDGE

verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि |
यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् ||५-१||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
saṃnyāsaṃ karmaṇāṃ kṛṣṇa punaryogaṃ ca śaṃsasi .
yacchreya etayorekaṃ tanme brūhi suniścitam ..5-1..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
1. Renunciation-of-actions, O Krishna, You praise and again YOGA --- performance-of- actions. Tell me conclusively that which is the better of the two.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ |
तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ||५-२||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
saṃnyāsaḥ karmayogaśca niḥśreyasakarāvubhau .
tayostu karmasaṃnyāsātkarmayogo viśiṣyate ..5-2..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
2. Renunciation of action and YOGA -of-action both lead to the highest bliss; but of the two , YOGA -of-action is superior to the renunciation-of-action.

verses.hn:
ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति |
निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ||५-३||
verses.en:
jñeyaḥ sa nityasaṃnyāsī yo na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati .
nirdvandvo hi mahābāho sukhaṃ bandhātpramucyate ..5-3..
verses.desc: 3. He should be known as a perpetual SAMNYASI who neither hates nor desires; for, free from the pairs-of-opposites, O Mighty-armed, he is easily set free from bondage.

verses.hn:
साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः |
एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ||५-४||
verses.en:
sāṅkhyayogau pṛthagbālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ .
ekamapyāsthitaḥ samyagubhayorvindate phalam ..5-4..
verses.desc: 4. Children, not the wise, speak of SANKHYA (Knowledge) and YOGA (YOGA -of- action) as distinct; he who is truly established even in one, obtains the fruits of both.

verses.hn:
यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते |
एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||५-५||
verses.en:
yatsāṅkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṃ tadyogairapi gamyate .
ekaṃ sāṅkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ..5-5..
verses.desc:
5. That place which is reached by the SANKHYAS (JNANIS) is also reached by the
YOGINS (KARMA-YOGINS) . He "sees, " who "sees " SANKHYA and YOGA as one.

verses.hn:
संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः |
योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||५-६||
verses.en:
saṃnyāsastu mahābāho duḥkhamāptumayogataḥ .
yogayukto munirbrahma nacireṇādhigacchati ..5-6..
verses.desc:
6. But renunciation, O mighty-armed, is hard to attain without YOGA; the YOGA -
harmonised man of (steady) contemplation quickly goes to BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः |
सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ||५-७||
verses.en:
yogayukto viśuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ .
sarvabhūtātmabhūtātmā kurvannapi na lipyate ..5-7..
verses.desc:
7. He who is devoted to the Path-of-action, whose mind is quite pure, who has conquered
the self, who has subdued his senses, who realises his Self as the Self in all beings, though
acting, is not tainted.

verses.hn:
नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् |
पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् ||५-८||
verses.en:
naiva kiñcitkaromīti yukto manyeta tattvavit .
paśyañśruṇvanspṛśañjighrannaśnangacchansvapañśvasan ..5-8..
verses.desc:
8. "I do nothing at all, " thus would the harmonised knower of Truth think seeing,
hearing, touching, smelling, eating, going, sleeping, breathing,

verses.hn:
प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि |
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ||५-९||
verses.en:
pralapanvisṛjangṛhṇannunmiṣannimiṣannapi .
indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣu vartanta iti dhārayan ..5-9..
verses.desc:
9. Speaking, letting go, seizing, opening and closing the eyes --- convinced that the senses
move among the sense-objects.

verses.hn:
ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः |
लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा ||५-१०||
verses.en:
brahmaṇyādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā karoti yaḥ .
lipyate na sa pāpena padmapatramivāmbhasā ..5-10..
verses.desc:
10. He who does actions, offering them to BRAHMAN, abandoning attachment, is not
tainted by sin, just as a lotus leaf remains unaffected by the water on it.

verses.hn:
कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि |
योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये ||५-११||
verses.en:
kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalairindriyairapi .
yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṃ tyaktvātmaśuddhaye ..5-11..
verses.desc:
11. YOGIS, having abandoned attachment, perform actions merely by the body, mind,
intellect and senses, for the purification of the self (ego) .

verses.hn:
युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् |
अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते ||५-१२||
verses.en:
yuktaḥ karmaphalaṃ tyaktvā śāntimāpnoti naiṣṭhikīm .
ayuktaḥ kāmakāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate ..5-12..
verses.desc:
12. The united one (the well-poised or the harmonised) , having abandoned the fruit of
action, attains Eternal Peace; the non-united (the unsteady or the unbalanced) , impelled
by desire and attached to the fruit, is bound.

verses.hn:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी |
नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ||५-१३||
verses.en:
sarvakarmāṇi manasā saṃnyasyāste sukhaṃ vaśī .
navadvāre pure dehī naiva kurvanna kārayan ..5-13..
verses.desc:
13. Mentally renouncing all actions and fully self-controlled, the "embodied" one rests
happily in the nine-gate city, neither acting nor causing others (body and senses) to act.

verses.hn:
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः |
न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ||५-१४||
verses.en:
na kartṛtvaṃ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛjati prabhuḥ .
na karmaphalasaṃyogaṃ svabhāvastu pravartate ..5-14..
verses.desc:
14. Neither agency nor actions does the Lord create for the world, nor union with the
fruits of actions. But it is Nature that acts.

verses.hn:
नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः |
अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः ||५-१५||
verses.en:
nādatte kasyacitpāpaṃ na caiva sukṛtaṃ vibhuḥ .
ajñānenāvṛtaṃ jñānaṃ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ ..5-15..
verses.desc:
15. The Lord takes neither the demerit not even the merit of any; knowledge is enveloped
by ignorance, thereby beings are deluded.

verses.hn:
ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः |
तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ||५-१६||
verses.en:
jñānena tu tadajñānaṃ yeṣāṃ nāśitamātmanaḥ .
teṣāmādityavajjñānaṃ prakāśayati tatparam ..5-16..
verses.desc:
16. But to those whose ignorance is destroyed by the Knowledge of the Self, like the sun,
to them Knowledge reveals the Supreme (BRAHMAN) .

verses.hn:
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः |
गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ||५-१७||
verses.en:
tadbuddhayastadātmānastanniṣṭhāstatparāyaṇāḥ .
gacchantyapunarāvṛttiṃ jñānanirdhūtakalmaṣāḥ ..5-17..
verses.desc:
17. Intellect absorbed in that, their Self being That, established in that, with That for their
Supreme Goal, they go whence there is no return, their sins dispelled by Knowledge.

verses.hn:
विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि |
शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः ||५-१८||
verses.en:
vidyāvinayasampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastini .
śuni caiva śvapāke ca paṇḍitāḥ samadarśinaḥ ..5-18..
verses.desc:
18. Sages look with an equal eye upon a BRAHMANA endowed with learning and
humility, on a cow, on an elephant, and even on a dog and an outcaste.

verses.hn:
इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः |
निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः ||५-१९||
verses.en:
ihaiva tairjitaḥ sargo yeṣāṃ sāmye sthitaṃ manaḥ .
nirdoṣaṃ hi samaṃ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ ..5-19..
verses.desc:
19. Even here (in this world) , birth (everything) is overcome by those whose minds rest in
equality; BRAHMAN is spotless indeed and equal; therefore they are established in
BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् |
स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ||५-२०||
verses.en:
na prahṛṣyetpriyaṃ prāpya nodvijetprāpya cāpriyam .
sthirabuddhirasammūḍho brahmavid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ ..5-20..
verses.desc:
20. Resting in BRAHMAN, with steady intellect and undeluded, the knower of
BRAHMAN neither rejoices on obtaining what is pleasant, nor grieves on obtaining what
is unpleasant.

verses.hn:
बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् |
स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ||५-२१||
verses.en:
bāhyasparśeṣvasaktātmā vindatyātmani yatsukham .
sa brahmayogayuktātmā sukhamakṣayamaśnute ..5-21..
verses.desc:
21. With the self unattached to external contacts, he finds happiness in the Self; with the
self engaged in the meditation of BRAHMAN, he attains endless happiness.

verses.hn:
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते |
आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ||५-२२||
verses.en:
ye hi saṃsparśajā bhogā duḥkhayonaya eva te .
ādyantavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣu ramate budhaḥ ..5-22..
verses.desc:
22. The enjoyments that are born of contacts are only generators of pain, for they have a
beginning and an end. O son of Kunti, the wise do not rejoice in them.

verses.hn:
शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् |
कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ||५-२३||
verses.en:
śaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṃ prākśarīravimokṣaṇāt .
kāmakrodhodbhavaṃ vegaṃ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ ..5-23..
verses.desc:
23. He who is able, while still here (in this world) to withstand, before the liberation from
the body (death) , the impulse born out of desire and anger, he is a YOGIN , he is a
happy man.

verses.hn:
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः |
स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ||५-२४||
verses.en:
yo.antaḥsukho.antarārāmastathāntarjyotireva yaḥ .
sa yogī brahmanirvāṇaṃ brahmabhūto.adhigacchati ..5-24..
verses.desc:
24. He who is happy within, who rejoices within, who is illuminated within, that YOGI
attains Absolute Freedom or MOKSHA, himself becomin g BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः |
छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ||५-२५||
verses.en:
labhante brahmanirvāṇamṛṣayaḥ kṣīṇakalmaṣāḥ .
chinnadvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ ..5-25..
verses.desc:
25. Those RISHIS obtain Absolute Freedom or MOKSHA --- whose sins have been
destroyed, whose dualities are torn asunder, who are self-controlled and intent on the
welfare of all beings.

verses.hn:
कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् |
अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ||५-२६||
verses.en:
kāmakrodhaviyuktānāṃ yatīnāṃ yatacetasām .
abhito brahmanirvāṇaṃ vartate viditātmanām ..5-26..
verses.desc:
26. Absolute Freedom (or BRAHMIC Bliss) exists on all sides for those self-controlled
ascetics, who are free from desire and anger, who have controlled their thoughts and
who have realised the Self.

verses.hn:
स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः |
प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ ||५-२७||
verses.en:
sparśānkṛtvā bahirbāhyāṃścakṣuścaivāntare bhruvoḥ .
prāṇāpānau samau kṛtvā nāsābhyantaracāriṇau ..5-27..
verses.desc:
27. Shutting out (all) external contacts and fixing the gaze (as though) between the eye-
brows, equalising the outgoing and incoming breath moving within the nostrils,

verses.hn:
यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः |
विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः ||५-२८||
verses.en:
yatendriyamanobuddhirmunirmokṣaparāyaṇaḥ .
vigatecchābhayakrodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ ..5-28..
verses.desc:
28. With senses, mind and intellect (ever) controlled, having liberation as his Supreme
Goal, free from desire, fear and anger --- the sage is verily liberated for ever.

verses.hn:
भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् |
सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति ||५-२९||
verses.en:
bhoktāraṃ yajñatapasāṃ sarvalokamaheśvaram .
suhṛdaṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ jñātvā māṃ śāntimṛcchati ..5-29..
verses.desc:
29. Knowing Me as Enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, the Great Lord of all worlds, the
friend of all beings, he attains Peace.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
संन्यासयोगो नाम पञ्चमोऽध्यायः ||५||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde saṃnyāsayogo nāma pañcamo.adhyāyaḥ ..5-30..
verses.desc:
Thus in the UPANISHAD of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the Scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna the fifth discourse ends entitled:
YOGA OF TRUE RENUNCIATION.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः |
स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||६-१||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
anāśritaḥ karmaphalaṃ kāryaṃ karma karoti yaḥ .
sa saṃnyāsī ca yogī ca na niragnirna cākriyaḥ ..6-1..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
1. He who performs his bounden duty without depending on the fruits-of-actions --- he is a SAMNYASIN and a YOGIN ; not he who (has renounced) is without fire and without action.

verses.hn:
यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव |
न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ||६-२||
verses.en:
yaṃ saṃnyāsamiti prāhuryogaṃ taṃ viddhi pāṇḍava .
na hyasaṃnyastasaṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaścana ..6-2..
verses.desc: 2. O Pandava, please know YOGA to be that which they call renunciation; no one verily becomes a YOGI who has not renounced thoughts.

verses.hn:
आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते |
योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ||६-३||
verses.en:
ārurukṣormuneryogaṃ karma kāraṇamucyate .
yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śamaḥ kāraṇamucyate ..6-3..
verses.desc: 3. For a MUNI or sage who "wishes to attain to YOGA, " action is said to be the means; for the same sage who has "attained to YOGA, " inaction (quiescence) is said to be the means.

verses.hn:
यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते |
सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ||६-४||
verses.en:
yadā hi nendriyārtheṣu na karmasvanuṣajjate .
sarvasaṅkalpasaṃnyāsī yogārūḍhastadocyate ..6-4..
verses.desc: 4. When a man is not attached to sense-objects or to actions, having renounced all thoughts, then he is said to have attained to YOGA.

verses.hn:
उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् |
आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ||६-५||
verses.en:
uddharedātmanātmānaṃ nātmānamavasādayet .
ātmaiva hyātmano bandhurātmaiva ripurātmanaḥ ..6-5..
verses.desc:
5. Let a man lift himself by his own Self alone, and let him not lower himself; for, this Self
alone is the friend of oneself, and this Self is the enemy of oneself.

verses.hn:
बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः |
अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||६-६||
verses.en:
bandhurātmātmanastasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ .
anātmanastu śatrutve vartetātmaiva śatruvat ..6-6..
verses.desc:
6. The Self is the friend of the self for him who has conquered himself by the Self, but to
the unconquered self, the Self stands in the position of an enemy like the (external) foe.

verses.hn:
जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः |
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ||६-७||
verses.en:
jitātmanaḥ praśāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ .
śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkheṣu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ ..6-7..
verses.desc:
7. The Supreme Self of him who is self-controlled and peaceful, is balanced in cold and
heat, pleasure and pain, as also in honour and dishonour.

verses.hn:
ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः |
युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ||६-८||
verses.en:
jñānavijñānatṛptātmā kūṭastho vijitendriyaḥ .
yukta ityucyate yogī samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ ..6-8..
verses.desc:
8. The YOGI who is satisfied with knowledge and wisdom, who remains unshaken, who
has conquered the senses, to whom a lump of earth, a stone and gold are the same, is said
to be harmonised (i. e. , is said to have attained NIRVIKALPA SAMADHI) .

verses.hn:
सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु |
साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ||६-९||
verses.en:
suhṛnmitrāryudāsīnamadhyasthadveṣyabandhuṣu .
sādhuṣvapi ca pāpeṣu samabuddhirviśiṣyate ..6-9..
verses.desc:
9. He who is of the same mind to the good-hearted, friends, enemies, the indifferent, the
neutral, the hateful, relatives, the righteous and the unrighteous, he excels.

verses.hn:
योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः |
एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ||६-१०||
verses.en:
yogī yuñjīta satatamātmānaṃ rahasi sthitaḥ .
ekākī yatacittātmā nirāśīraparigrahaḥ ..6-10..
verses.desc:
10. Let the YOGI try constantly to keep the mind steady, remaining in solitude, alone,
with the mind and body controlled, free from hope and greed.

verses.hn:
शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः |
नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ||६-११||
verses.en:
śucau deśe pratiṣṭhāpya sthiramāsanamātmanaḥ .
nātyucchritaṃ nātinīcaṃ cailājinakuśottaram ..6-11..
verses.desc:
11. Having, in a clean spot, established a firm seat of his own, neither too high nor too
low, made of a cloth, a skin and KUSHA -grass, one over the other, . . .

verses.hn:
तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः |
उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ||६-१२||
verses.en:
tatraikāgraṃ manaḥ kṛtvā yatacittendriyakriyaḥ .
upaviśyāsane yuñjyādyogamātmaviśuddhaye ..6-12..
verses.desc:
12. There, having made the mind one-pointed, with the actions of the mind and the senses
controlled, let him, seated on the seat, practise YOGA, for the purification of the self.

verses.hn:
समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः |
सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||६-१३||
verses.en:
samaṃ kāyaśirogrīvaṃ dhārayannacalaṃ sthiraḥ .
samprekṣya nāsikāgraṃ svaṃ diśaścānavalokayan ..6-13..
verses.desc:
13. Let him firmly hold his body, head and neck erect and still, gazing at the tip of his
nose, without looking around.

verses.hn:
प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः |
मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ||६-१४||
verses.en:
praśāntātmā vigatabhīrbrahmacārivrate sthitaḥ .
manaḥ saṃyamya maccitto yukta āsīta matparaḥ ..6-14..
verses.desc:
14. Serene-minded, fearless, firm in the vow of BRAHMACHARYA, having controlled
the mind, thinking on Me and balanced, let him sit, having Me as the Supreme Goal.

verses.hn:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः |
शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ||६-१५||
verses.en:
yuñjannevaṃ sadātmānaṃ yogī niyatamānasaḥ .
śāntiṃ nirvāṇaparamāṃ matsaṃsthāmadhigacchati ..6-15..
verses.desc:
15. Thus, always keeping the mind balanced, the YOGI, with his mind controlled, attains
to the Peace abiding in Me, which culminates in total liberation (NIRVANA or
MOKSHA) .

verses.hn:
नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः |
न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ||६-१६||
verses.en:
nātyaśnatastu yogo.asti na caikāntamanaśnataḥ .
na cātisvapnaśīlasya jāgrato naiva cārjuna ..6-16..
verses.desc:
16. Verily, YOGA is not possible for him who eats too much, nor for him who does not
eat at all; nor for him who sleeps too much, nor for him who is (always) awake, O
Arjuna.

verses.hn:
युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु |
युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ||६-१७||
verses.en:
yuktāhāravihārasya yuktaceṣṭasya karmasu .
yuktasvapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkhahā ..6-17..
verses.desc:
17. YOGA becomes the destroyer of pain for him who is moderate in eating and
recreation, who is moderate in his exertion during his actions, who is moderate in sleep
and wakefulness.

verses.hn:
यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते |
निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||६-१८||
verses.en:
yadā viniyataṃ cittamātmanyevāvatiṣṭhate .
niḥspṛhaḥ sarvakāmebhyo yukta ityucyate tadā ..6-18..
verses.desc:
18. When the perfectly controlled mind rests in the Self only, free from longing for all
(objects of) desire, then it is said: "he is united" (YUKTAH) .

verses.hn:
यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता |
योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ||६-१९||
verses.en:
yathā dīpo nivātastho neṅgate sopamā smṛtā .
yogino yatacittasya yuñjato yogamātmanaḥ ..6-19..
verses.desc:
19. " As a lamp placed in a windless place does not flicker" --- is a simile used to describe
the YOGI of controlled-mind, practising YOGA of the Self (or absorbed in th e YOGA -
of-the-Self) .

verses.hn:
यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया |
यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ||६-२०||
verses.en:
yatroparamate cittaṃ niruddhaṃ yogasevayā .
yatra caivātmanātmānaṃ paśyannātmani tuṣyati ..6-20..
verses.desc:
20. When the mind, restrained by the practice of YOGA, attains quietude and when
seeing the Self by the self, he is satisfied in his own Self;

verses.hn:
सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद् बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् |
वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ||६-२१||
verses.en:
sukhamātyantikaṃ yattad buddhigrāhyamatīndriyam .
vetti yatra na caivāyaṃ sthitaścalati tattvataḥ ..6-21..

verses.hn:
यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः |
यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ||६-२२||
verses.en:
yaṃ labdhvā cāparaṃ lābhaṃ manyate nādhikaṃ tataḥ .
yasminsthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vicālyate ..6-22..
verses.desc:
22. Which, having obtained, he thinks there is no other gain superior to it; wherein
established, he is not moved even by heavy sorrow.

verses.hn:
तं विद्याद् दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् |
स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ||६-२३||
verses.en:
taṃ vidyād duḥkhasaṃyogaviyogaṃ yogasaṃjñitam .
sa niścayena yoktavyo yogo.anirviṇṇacetasā ..6-23..
verses.desc:
23. Let it be known: the severance from the union-with-pain is YOGA. This YOGA
should be practised with determination and with a mind steady and undespairing.

verses.hn:
सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः |
मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ||६-२४||
verses.en:
saṅkalpaprabhavānkāmāṃstyaktvā sarvānaśeṣataḥ .
manasaivendriyagrāmaṃ viniyamya samantataḥ ..6-24..
verses.desc:
24. Abandoning without reserve all desires born of SANKALPA, and completely
restraining the whole group of senses by the mind from all sides.

verses.hn:
शनैः शनैरुपरमेद् बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया |
आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||६-२५||
verses.en:
śanaiḥ śanairuparamed buddhyā dhṛtigṛhītayā .
ātmasaṃsthaṃ manaḥ kṛtvā na kiñcidapi cintayet ..6-25..
verses.desc:
25. Little by little, let him attain quietude by his intellect, held firm; having made the
mind established in the Self, let him not think of anything.

verses.hn:
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् |
ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ||६-२६||
verses.en:
yato yato niścarati manaścañcalamasthiram .
tatastato niyamyaitadātmanyeva vaśaṃ nayet ..6-26..
verses.desc:
26. From whatever cause the restless and the unsteady mind wanders away, from that let
him restrain it, and bring it back under the control of the Self alone.

verses.hn:
प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् |
उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ||६-२७||
verses.en:
praśāntamanasaṃ hyenaṃ yoginaṃ sukhamuttamam .
upaiti śāntarajasaṃ brahmabhūtamakalmaṣam ..6-27..
verses.desc:
27. Supreme Bliss verily comes to this YOGI, whose mind is quite peaceful, whose passion
is quietened, who is free from sin, and who has become BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः |
सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ||६-२८||
verses.en:
yuñjannevaṃ sadātmānaṃ yogī vigatakalmaṣaḥ .
sukhena brahmasaṃsparśamatyantaṃ sukhamaśnute ..6-28..
verses.desc:
28. The YOGI engaging the mind thus (in the practice of YOGA ) , freed from sins, easily
enjoys the Infinite Bliss of 'BRAHMAN -contact. '

verses.hn:
सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि |
ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ||६-२९||
verses.en:
sarvabhūtasthamātmānaṃ sarvabhūtāni cātmani .
īkṣate yogayuktātmā sarvatra samadarśanaḥ ..6-29..
verses.desc:
29. With the mind harmonised by YOGA he sees the Self abiding in all beings, and all
beings in the Self; he sees the same everywhere.

verses.hn:
यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति |
तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||६-३०||
verses.en:
yo māṃ paśyati sarvatra sarvaṃ ca mayi paśyati .
tasyāhaṃ na praṇaśyāmi sa ca me na praṇaśyati ..6-30..
verses.desc:
30. He who sees Me everywhere, and sees everything in Me, he never gets separated from
Me, nor do I get separated from him.

verses.hn:
सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः |
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||६-३१||
verses.en:
sarvabhūtasthitaṃ yo māṃ bhajatyekatvamāsthitaḥ .
sarvathā vartamāno.api sa yogī mayi vartate ..6-31..
verses.desc:
31. He who, being established in unity, worships Me, dwelling in all beings, that YOGI
abides in Me, whatever be his mode of living.

verses.hn:
आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन |
सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ||६-३२||
verses.en:
ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṃ paśyati yo.arjuna .
sukhaṃ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṃ sa yogī paramo mataḥ ..6-32..
verses.desc:
32. He who, through the likeness (sameness) of the Self, O Arjuna, sees equality
everywhere, be it pleasure or pain, he is regarded as the highest YOGI.

verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन |
एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ||६-३३||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
yo.ayaṃ yogastvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana .
etasyāhaṃ na paśyāmi cañcalatvātsthitiṃ sthirām ..6-33..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
33. This YOGA of Equanimity, taught by Thee, O slayer of Madhu, I see not its enduring
continuity, because of the restlessness (of the mind) .

verses.hn:
चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद् दृढम् |
तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ||६-३४||
verses.en:
cañcalaṃ hi manaḥ kṛṣṇa pramāthi balavad dṛḍham .
tasyāhaṃ nigrahaṃ manye vāyoriva suduṣkaram ..6-34..
verses.desc:
34. The mind verily is, O Krishna, restless, turbulent, strong and unyielding; I deem it
quite as difficult to control as the wind.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् |
अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||६-३५||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
asaṃśayaṃ mahābāho mano durnigrahaṃ calam .
abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa ca gṛhyate ..6-35..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
35. Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed one, the mind is difficult to control and is restless; but,
by practice, O Son of Kunti, and by dispassion, it is restrained.

verses.hn:
असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः |
वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ||६-३६||
verses.en:
asaṃyatātmanā yogo duṣprāpa iti me matiḥ .
vaśyātmanā tu yatatā śakyo.avāptumupāyataḥ ..6-36..
verses.desc:
36 . YOGA, I think is hard to be attained by one of uncontrolled self; but the self-
controlled, striving, can obtain it by (proper) means.

verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः |
अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||६-३७||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
ayatiḥ śraddhayopeto yogāccalitamānasaḥ .
aprāpya yogasaṃsiddhiṃ kāṃ gatiṃ kṛṣṇa gacchati ..6-37..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
37. He who, though possessed of faith, is unable to control himself, whose mind wanders
away from YOGA, to what end does he, having failed to attain perfection in YOGA go,
O Krishna?

verses.hn:
कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति |
अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ||६-३८||
verses.en:
kaccinnobhayavibhraṣṭaśchinnābhramiva naśyati .
apratiṣṭho mahābāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi ..6-38..
verses.desc:
38. Fallen from both, does he not, O mighty-armed, perish like a rent cloud, supportless
and deluded in the path of BRAHMAN?

verses.hn:
एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः |
त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ||६-३९||
verses.en:
etanme saṃśayaṃ kṛṣṇa chettumarhasyaśeṣataḥ .
tvadanyaḥ saṃśayasyāsya chettā na hyupapadyate ..6-39..
verses.desc:
39. This doubt of mine, O Krishna, please dispel completely; because it is not possible for
any one but You to dispel this doubt.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते |
न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद् दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||६-४०||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśastasya vidyate .
na hi kalyāṇakṛtkaścid durgatiṃ tāta gacchati ..6-40..

verses.hn:
प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः |
शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ||६-४१||
verses.en:
prāpya puṇyakṛtāṃ lokānuṣitvā śāśvatīḥ samāḥ .
śucīnāṃ śrīmatāṃ gehe yogabhraṣṭo.abhijāyate ..6-41..
verses.desc:
41 Having attained to the worlds of the righteous, and having dwelt there for everlasting
(long) years, he who had fallen from YOGA is born again in the house of the pure and
the wealthy.

verses.hn:
अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् |
एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||६-४२||
verses.en:
athavā yogināmeva kule bhavati dhīmatām .
etaddhi durlabhataraṃ loke janma yadīdṛśam ..6-42..
verses.desc:
42. Or, he is even born in the family of the wise YOGIS; verily, a birth like this is very
difficult to obtain in this world.

verses.hn:
तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् |
यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||६-४३||
verses.en:
tatra taṃ buddhisaṃyogaṃ labhate paurvadehikam .
yatate ca tato bhūyaḥ saṃsiddhau kurunandana ..6-43..
verses.desc:
43. There he comes to be united with the knowledge acquired in his former body and
strives more than before for Perfection, O son of the Kurus.

verses.hn:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः |
जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ||६-४४||
verses.en:
pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hyavaśo.api saḥ .
jijñāsurapi yogasya śabdabrahmātivartate ..6-44..
verses.desc:
44. By that very former practice he is borne on inspite of himself. Even he who merely
wishes to know YOGA goes beyond the SHABDA BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः |
अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||६-४५||
verses.en:
prayatnādyatamānastu yogī saṃśuddhakilbiṣaḥ .
anekajanmasaṃsiddhastato yāti parāṃ gatim ..6-45..
verses.desc:
45. But the YOGI, who strives with assiduity, purified from sins and perfected (gradually)
through many births, then attains the highest Goal.

verses.hn:
तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः |
कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ||६-४६||
verses.en:
tapasvibhyo.adhiko yogī jñānibhyo.api mato.adhikaḥ .
karmibhyaścādhiko yogī tasmādyogī bhavārjuna ..6-46..
verses.desc:
46. The YOGI is thought to be superior to the ascetics, and even superior to men-of-
knowledge (mere scholars) ; he is also superior to men-of-action; therefore (you strive to)
be a YOGI, O Arjuna.

verses.hn:
योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना |
श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ||६-४७||
verses.en:
yogināmapi sarveṣāṃ madgatenāntarātmanā .
śraddhāvānbhajate yo māṃ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ ..6-47..
verses.desc:
47. And among all YOGIS, he who, full of faith, with his inner-self merged in Me,
worships Me, is, according to Me, the most devout.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
आत्मसंयमयोगो नाम षष्ठोऽध्यायः ||६||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde ātmasaṃyamayogo nāma ṣaṣṭho.adhyāyaḥ ..6-48..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the sixth discourse ends entitled:
THE YOGA OF MEDITATION

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः |
असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||७-१||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
mayyāsaktamanāḥ pārtha yogaṃ yuñjanmadāśrayaḥ .
asaṃśayaṃ samagraṃ māṃ yathā jñāsyasi tacchṛṇu ..7-1..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
1. With the mind intent on Me, Partha, practising YOGA and taking refuge in Me, how thou shalt, without doubt, know Me fully, that do thou hear.

verses.hn:
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः |
यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||७-२||
verses.en:
jñānaṃ te.ahaṃ savijñānamidaṃ vakṣyāmyaśeṣataḥ .
yajjñātvā neha bhūyo.anyajjñātavyamavaśiṣyate ..7-2..
verses.desc: 2. I shall declare to thee in full this knowledge combined with realisation, which being known, nothing more here remains to be known.

verses.hn:
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये |
यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ||७-३||
verses.en:
manuṣyāṇāṃ sahasreṣu kaścidyatati siddhaye .
yatatāmapi siddhānāṃ kaścinmāṃ vetti tattvataḥ ..7-3..
verses.desc: 3. Among thousands of men, one perchance strives, for perfection; even among those successful strivers, only one perchance knows Me in essence.

verses.hn:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च |
अहंकार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ||७-४||
verses.en:
bhūmirāpo.analo vāyuḥ khaṃ mano buddhireva ca .
ahaṃkāra itīyaṃ me bhinnā prakṛtiraṣṭadhā ..7-4..
verses.desc: 4. Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, egoism --- these are My eight-fold PRAKRITI.

verses.hn:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् |
जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||७-५||
verses.en:
apareyamitastvanyāṃ prakṛtiṃ viddhi me parām .
jīvabhūtāṃ mahābāho yayedaṃ dhāryate jagat ..7-5..
verses.desc:
5. This is the "lower" PRAKRITI; different from it, know thou, O mighty-armed, My
"Higher' ' PRAKRITI , the very Life-element, by which this world is upheld.

verses.hn:
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय |
अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ||७-६||
verses.en:
etadyonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇītyupadhāraya .
ahaṃ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayastathā ..7-6..
verses.desc:
6. Know that these (two PRAKRITIS ) , are the womb of all beings. So I am the source
and dissolution of the whole universe.

verses.hn:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय |
मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||७-७||
verses.en:
mattaḥ parataraṃ nānyatkiñcidasti dhanañjaya .
mayi sarvamidaṃ protaṃ sūtre maṇigaṇā iva ..7-7..
verses.desc:
7. There is nothing whatsoever higher than Me, O Dhananjaya. All this is strung in Me, as
clusters of gems on a string.

verses.hn:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः |
प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ||७-८||
verses.en:
raso.ahamapsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśisūryayoḥ .
praṇavaḥ sarvavedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṃ nṛṣu ..7-8..
verses.desc:
8. I am the sapidity in water, O son of Kunti, I am the light in the moon and the sun; I am
the syllable OM in all the VEDAS, sound in ether, and virility in men;

verses.hn:
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ |
जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ||७-९||
verses.en:
puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṃ ca tejaścāsmi vibhāvasau .
jīvanaṃ sarvabhūteṣu tapaścāsmi tapasviṣu ..7-9..
verses.desc:
9. I am the sweet fragrance in earth and the brilliance in fire, the life in all beings, and I
am austerity in the austere.

verses.hn:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् |
बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ||७-१०||
verses.en:
bījaṃ māṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ viddhi pārtha sanātanam .
buddhirbuddhimatāmasmi tejastejasvināmaham ..7-10..
verses.desc:
10. Know Me, O Partha, as the eternal seed of all beings; I am the intelligence of the
intelligent. The splendour of the splendid (things and beings) , am I.

verses.hn:
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् |
धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ||७-११||
verses.en:
balaṃ balavatāṃ cāhaṃ kāmarāgavivarjitam .
dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo.asmi bharatarṣabha ..7-11-
verses.desc:
11. Of the strong, I am the strength --- devoid of desire and attachment, and in (all)
beings, I am the desire --- unopposed to DHARMA, O best among the Bharatas.

verses.hn:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये |
मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||७-१२||
verses.en:
ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasāstāmasāśca ye .
matta eveti tānviddhi na tvahaṃ teṣu te mayi ..7-12..
verses.desc:
12. Whatever beings (and objects) that are pure, active and inert, know them to proceed
from Me; yet, I am not in them, they are in Me.

verses.hn:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् |
मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ||७-१३||
verses.en:
tribhirguṇamayairbhāvairebhiḥ sarvamidaṃ jagat .
mohitaṃ nābhijānāti māmebhyaḥ paramavyayam ..7-13..
verses.desc:
13. Deluded by these natures (states or things) composed of the three GUNAS (of
PRAKRITI ) all the world knows Me not as Immutable and distinct from them.

verses.hn:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया |
मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||७-१४||
verses.en:
daivī hyeṣā guṇamayī mama māyā duratyayā .
māmeva ye prapadyante māyāmetāṃ taranti te ..7-14..
verses.desc:
14. Verily, this divine illusion of Mine, made up of GUNAS (caused by the qualities) is
difficult to cross over; those who take refuge in Me, they alone cross over this illusion.

verses.hn:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः |
माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ||७-१५||
verses.en:
na māṃ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ .
māyayāpahṛtajñānā āsuraṃ bhāvamāśritāḥ ..7-15..
verses.desc:
15 The evil-doers, the deluded, the lowest of men, do not seek Me; they, whose
discrimination has been destroyed by their own delusions, follow the ways of the demons.

verses.hn:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन |
आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ||७-१६||
verses.en:
caturvidhā bhajante māṃ janāḥ sukṛtino.arjuna .
ārto jijñāsurarthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha ..7-16..
verses.desc:
16. Four kinds of virtuous men worship Me, O Arjuna, the dissatisfied, the seeker of
(systematised) knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise, O best among the Bharatas.

verses.hn:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते |
प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||७-१७||
verses.en:
teṣāṃ jñānī nityayukta ekabhaktirviśiṣyate .
priyo hi jñānino.atyarthamahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ ..7-17..
verses.desc:
17. Of them the wise, ever steadfast and devoted to the One, excels; for, I am exceedingly
dear to the wise, and he is dear to Me.

verses.hn:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् |
आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||७-१८||
verses.en:
udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matam .
āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā māmevānuttamāṃ gatim ..7-18..
verses.desc:
18. Noble indeed are all these, but the wise man, I deem, as My very Self; for, steadfast in
mind he is established in Me alone as the Supreme Goal.

verses.hn:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते |
वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ||७-१९||
verses.en:
bahūnāṃ janmanāmante jñānavānmāṃ prapadyate .
vāsudevaḥ sarvamiti sa mahātmā sudurlabhaḥ ..7-19..
verses.desc:
19. At the end of many births the wise man comes to Me, realising that all this is
Vasudeva (the innermost Self) ; such a great soul (MAHATMA) is very hard to find.

verses.hn:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः |
तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ||७-२०||
verses.en:
kāmaistaistairhṛtajñānāḥ prapadyante.anyadevatāḥ .
taṃ taṃ niyamamāsthāya prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā ..7-20..
verses.desc:
20. Those whose wisdom has been looted away by this or that desire, go to other gods,
following this or that rite, led by their own nature.

verses.hn:
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति |
तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||७-२१||
verses.en:
yo yo yāṃ yāṃ tanuṃ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitumicchati .
tasya tasyācalāṃ śraddhāṃ tāmeva vidadhāmyaham ..7-21..
verses.desc:
21. Whatsoever form any devotee desires to worship with faith --- that (same) faith of his
I make (firm and) unflinching.

verses.hn:
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते |
लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||७-२२||
verses.en:
sa tayā śraddhayā yuktastasyārādhanamīhate .
labhate ca tataḥ kāmānmayaivavihitānhi tān ..7-22..
verses.desc:
22. Endued with that faith, he engages in the worship of that 'DEVATA' and from it he
obtains his desire-fulfilments; all these being ordained, indeed, by Me (alone) .

verses.hn:
अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् |
देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ||७-२३||
verses.en:
antavattu phalaṃ teṣāṃ tadbhavatyalpamedhasām .
devāndevayajo yānti madbhaktā yānti māmapi ..7-23..
verses.desc:
23. Verily the "fruit" that accrues to those men of little-intelligence is finite. The
worshippers of the DEVAS go to the DEVAS but My devotees come to Me.

verses.hn:
अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः |
परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ||७-२४||
verses.en:
avyaktaṃ vyaktimāpannaṃ manyante māmabuddhayaḥ .
paraṃ bhāvamajānanto mamāvyayamanuttamam ..7-24..
verses.desc:
24. The foolish think of Me, the Unmanifest, as having come to manifestation, not
knowing My higher, immutable and peerless nature.

verses.hn:
नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः |
मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ||७-२५||
verses.en:
nāhaṃ prakāśaḥ sarvasya yogamāyāsamāvṛtaḥ .
mūḍho.ayaṃ nābhijānāti loko māmajamavyayam ..7-25..
verses.desc:
25. I am not manifest to all (in My Real Nature) veiled by Divine- 'MAYA. ' This deluded
world knows not Me, the Unborn, the Imperishable.

verses.hn:
वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन |
भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||७-२६||
verses.en:
vedāhaṃ samatītāni vartamānāni cārjuna .
bhaviṣyāṇi ca bhūtāni māṃ tu veda na kaścana ..7-26..
verses.desc:
26. I know, O Arjuna, the beings of the past, and present and the future, but no one
knows Me.

verses.hn:
इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत |
सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ||७-२७||
verses.en:
icchādveṣasamutthena dvandvamohena bhārata .
sarvabhūtāni sammohaṃ sarge yānti parantapa ..7-27..
verses.desc:
27. By the delusion of the pairs-of-opposites arising from desire and aversion, O Bharata,
all beings are subject to delusion at birth, O Parantapa (scorcher of foes) .

verses.hn:
येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् |
ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ||७-२८||
verses.en:
yeṣāṃ tvantagataṃ pāpaṃ janānāṃ puṇyakarmaṇām .
te dvandvamohanirmuktā bhajante māṃ dṛḍhavratāḥ ..7-28..
verses.desc:
28. But those men of virtuous deeds whose sins have come to an end, who are freed from
the delusion of the pairs-of-opposites and steadfast in vows, worship Me.

verses.hn:
जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये |
ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||७-२९||
verses.en:
jarāmaraṇamokṣāya māmāśritya yatanti ye .
te brahma tadviduḥ kṛtsnamadhyātmaṃ karma cākhilam ..7-29..
verses.desc:
29. Those who strive for liberation from old age and death, taking refuge in Me --- They
realise in full that BRAHMAN, the whole knowledge of the Self and all action.

verses.hn:
साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः |
प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ||७-३०||
verses.en:
sādhibhūtādhidaivaṃ māṃ sādhiyajñaṃ ca ye viduḥ .
prayāṇakāle.api ca māṃ te viduryuktacetasaḥ ..7-30..
verses.desc:
30. Those who know Me with the ADHIBHUTA (pertaining to elements; the world-of-
objects) , ADHIDAIVA (pertaining to the gods; the sense-organs) and the ADHIYAJNA
(pertaining to the sacrifice; all perceptions) , even at the time of death, steadfast in mind, know Me.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
ज्ञानविज्ञानयोगो नाम सप्तमोऽध्यायः ||७||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde jñānavijñānayogo nāma saptamo.adhyāyaḥ ..7-31..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the Scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Shri Krishna and Arjuna, the seventh discourse ends entitled:
THE YOGA OF KNOWLEDGE AND WISDOM

verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
किं तद् ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम |
अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ||८-१||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
kiṃ tad brahma kimadhyātmaṃ kiṃ karma puruṣottama .
adhibhūtaṃ ca kiṃ proktamadhidaivaṃ kimucyate ..8-1..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
1. What is that BRAHMAN? What is the ADHYATMA ? What is 'action' ? O best among men, what is declared to be the ADHIBHUTA? And what is ADHIDAIVA said to be?

verses.hn:
अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन |
प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः ||८-२||
verses.en:
adhiyajñaḥ kathaṃ ko.atra dehe.asminmadhusūdana .
prayāṇakāle ca kathaṃ jñeyo.asi niyatātmabhiḥ ..8-2..
verses.desc: 2. Who, and how, is ADHIYAJNA here in this body, O destroyer of Madhu? And how, at the time of death, are you to be known by the self-controlled?

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते |
भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः ||८-३||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
akṣaraṃ brahma paramaṃ svabhāvo.adhyātmamucyate .
bhūtabhāvodbhavakaro visargaḥ karmasaṃjñitaḥ ..8-3..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
3 . BRAHMAN is Imperishable, the Supreme; His essential nature is called Self- knowledge, the creative force that causes beings to spring forth into manifestation is called "work. "

verses.hn:
अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् |
अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ||८-४||
verses.en:
adhibhūtaṃ kṣaro bhāvaḥ puruṣaścādhidaivatam .
adhiyajño.ahamevātra dehe dehabhṛtāṃ vara ..8-4..
verses.desc: 4. ADHIBHUTA (or elements) constitutes My perishable nature, and the Indweller (or the essence) is the ADHIDAIVATA; I alone am the ADHIYAJNA here, in this body, O best of the embodied.

verses.hn:
अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् |
यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ||८-५||
verses.en:
antakāle ca māmeva smaranmuktvā kalevaram .
yaḥ prayāti sa madbhāvaṃ yāti nāstyatra saṃśayaḥ ..8-5..
verses.desc:
5. And whosoever, leaving the body, goes forth remembering Me alone, at the time of his
death, he attains My being; there is no doubt about this.

verses.hn:
यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् |
तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ||८-६||
verses.en:
yaṃ yaṃ vāpi smaranbhāvaṃ tyajatyante kalevaram .
taṃ tamevaiti kaunteya sadā tadbhāvabhāvitaḥ ..8-6..
verses.desc:
6. Whosoever, at the end, leaves the body, thinking of any being, to that being only he
goes, O Kaunteya (O son of Kunti) , because of his constant thought of that being.

verses.hn:
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च |
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः (orसंशयम्) ||८-७||
verses.en:
tasmātsarveṣu kāleṣu māmanusmara yudhya ca .
mayyarpitamanobuddhirmāmevaiṣyasyasaṃśayaḥ ..8-7..
verses.desc:
7. Therefore, at all times, remember Me, and fight, with mind and intellect fixed (or
absorbed) in Me; you shall doubtless come to Me alone.

verses.hn:
अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना |
परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ||८-८||
verses.en:
orsaṃśayama abhyāsayogayuktena cetasā nānyagāminā .
paramaṃ puruṣaṃ divyaṃ yāti pārthānucintayan ..8-8..
verses.desc:
8. With the mind not moving towards any other thing, made steadfast by the method of
habitual meditation, and constantly meditating on the Supreme PURUSHA, the
Resplendent, O Partha, he goes (to Him) .

verses.hn:
कविं पुराणमनुशासितार-
मणोरणीयंसमनुस्मरेद्यः |
सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप-
मादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ||८-९||
verses.en:
kaviṃ purāṇamanuśāsitāraṃ aṇoraṇīyaṃsamanusmaredyaḥ .
sarvasya dhātāramacintyarūpaṃ ādityavarṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt ..8-9..
verses.desc:
9. Whosoever, meditates upon the Omniscient, the Ancient, the Ruler (of the whole world)
, minuter than the atom, the Supporter of all, of Form inconceivable, Effulgent like the
Sun and beyond the darkness (of ignorance) . . .

verses.hn:
प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन
भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव |
भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक्
स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ||८-१०||
verses.en:
prayāṇakāle manasā.acalena bhaktyā yukto yogabalena caiva .
bhruvormadhye prāṇamāveśya samyak sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣamupaiti divyam ..8-10..
verses.desc:
10. At the time of death, with an unshaken mind full of devotion, by the power of 'YOGA'
fixing the whole 'PRANA' (breath) between the two eyebrows, he (the seeker) reaches the
Supreme Resplendent 'PURUSHA. '

verses.hn:
यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति
विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः |
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति
तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ||८-११||
verses.en:
yadakṣaraṃ vedavido vadanti viśanti yadyatayo vītarāgāḥ .
yadicchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti tatte padaṃ saṃgraheṇa pravakṣye ..8-11..
verses.desc:
11. That which is declared Imperishable by the VEDA -knowers; That into which, the
self-controlled and desire-freed enter; That desiring which BRAHMCHARYA is practised
--- That Goal I will declare to thee in brief.

verses.hn:
सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च |
मूध्न्यार्धायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ||८-१२||
verses.en:
sarvadvārāṇi saṃyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya ca .
mūdhnyā^^rdhāyātmanaḥ prāṇamāsthito yogadhāraṇām ..8-12..
verses.desc:
12. Having closed all the gates, having confined the mind in the heart, having fixed the
life-breath in the "head, " engaged in the practice of concentration,

verses.hn:
ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् |
यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ||८-१३||
verses.en:
omityekākṣaraṃ brahma vyāharanmāmanusmaran .
yaḥ prayāti tyajandehaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim ..8-13..
verses.desc:
13. Uttering the one-syllabled 'OM' --- the (symbol of) BRAHMAN --- and remembering
Me, he who departs, leaving the body, attains the Supreme Goal.

verses.hn:
अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः |
तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ||८-१४||
verses.en:
ananyacetāḥ satataṃ yo māṃ smarati nityaśaḥ .
tasyāhaṃ sulabhaḥ pārtha nityayuktasya yoginaḥ ..8-14..
verses.desc:
14. I am easily attainable by that ever-steadfast YOGI who constantly remembers Me
daily, not thinking of anything else, O Partha.

verses.hn:
मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् |
नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ||८-१५||
verses.en:
māmupetya punarjanma duḥkhālayamaśāśvatam .
nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṃsiddhiṃ paramāṃ gatāḥ ..8-15..
verses.desc:
15. Having attained Me, these MAHATMAS (great souls) do not again take birth, which
is the house of pain and is non-eternal, they having reached the Highest Perfection ,
MOKSHA.

verses.hn:
आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन |
मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ||८-१६||
verses.en:
ābrahmabhuvanāllokāḥ punarāvartino.arjuna .
māmupetya tu kaunteya punarjanma na vidyate ..8-16..
verses.desc:
16. Worlds upto the "world-of -BRAHMAJI" are subject to rebirth, O Arjuna; but he who
reaches Me, O Kaunteya, has no birth.

verses.hn:
सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद् ब्रह्मणो विदुः |
रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ||८-१७||
verses.en:
sahasrayugaparyantamaharyad brahmaṇo viduḥ .
rātriṃ yugasahasrāntāṃ te.ahorātravido janāḥ ..8-17..
verses.desc:
17. Those people who know (the length of) the day- of-BRAHMA which ends in a
thousand YUGAS (aeons) , and the night which (also) ends in a thousand YUGAS
(aeons) , they know day-and-night.

verses.hn:
अव्यक्ताद् व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे |
रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ||८-१८||
verses.en:
avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavantyaharāgame .
rātryāgame pralīyante tatraivāvyaktasaṃjñake ..8-18..
verses.desc:
18. From the unmanifested all the manifested proceed at the coming of the "day" ; at the
coming of "night" they dissolve verily in that alone which is called the unmanifest.

verses.hn:
भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते |
रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ||८-१९||
verses.en:
bhūtagrāmaḥ sa evāyaṃ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate .
rātryāgame.avaśaḥ pārtha prabhavatyaharāgame ..8-19..
verses.desc:
19. This same multiple of beings are being born again and again, and are dissolved (into
the unmanifest) ; helplessly, O Partha, at the coming of "night, " and they come forth
again at the coming of "day. "

verses.hn:
परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः |
यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ||८-२०||
verses.en:
parastasmāttu bhāvo.anyo.avyakto.avyaktātsanātanaḥ .
yaḥ sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati ..8-20..
verses.desc:
20. But verily there exists, higher than that unmanifest (AVYAKTA) , another
Unmanifested, which is Eternal, which is not destroyed when all beings are destroyed.

verses.hn:
अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् |
यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||८-२१||
verses.en:
avyakto.akṣara ityuktastamāhuḥ paramāṃ gatim .
yaṃ prāpya na nivartante taddhāma paramaṃ mama ..8-21..
verses.desc:
21. That which is called the Unmanifest and the Imperishable, that, they say is the
Highest Goal (path) . They who reach It never again return. That is My highest abode
(state) .

verses.hn:
पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया |
यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ||८-२२||
verses.en:
puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyastvananyayā .
yasyāntaḥsthāni bhūtāni yena sarvamidaṃ tatam ..8-22..
verses.desc:
22. That Highest 'PURUSHA' , O Partha, is attainable by unswerving devotion to Him
alone, within whom all beings dwell, by whom all this is pervaded.

verses.hn:
यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः |
प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ||८-२३||
verses.en:
yatra kāle tvanāvṛttimāvṛttiṃ caiva yoginaḥ .
prayātā yānti taṃ kālaṃ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha ..8-23..
verses.desc:
23. Now at what time (path) departing, YOGINS go, never to return, as also to return,
that time (path) , I will tell you, O Chief of Bharatas.

verses.hn:
अग्निर्जोतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् |
तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ||८-२४||
verses.en:
agnirjotirahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇmāsā uttarāyaṇam .
tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahmavido janāḥ ..8-24..
verses.desc:
24. Fire, light, day-time, the bright fortnight, the six months of the northern solstice;
following this path, men who know BRAHMAN go to BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् |
तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ||८-२५||
verses.en:
dhūmo rātristathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇmāsā dakṣiṇāyanam .
tatra cāndramasaṃ jyotiryogī prāpya nivartate ..8-25..
verses.desc:
25. Smoke, night-time, the dark fortnight, also six months of the southern solstice,
attaining by these to the Moon, the lunar light, the 'YOGI' returns.

verses.hn:
शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते |
एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ||८-२६||
verses.en:
śuklakṛṣṇe gatī hyete jagataḥ śāśvate mate .
ekayā yātyanāvṛttimanyayāvartate punaḥ ..8-26..
verses.desc:
26. The Path of Light and the Path of Darkness available for the world are verily thought
to be both eternal; by the one, the "Path of Light, " a man goes to return not; by the
other, the "Path of Darkness, " he returns again.

verses.hn:
नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन |
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ||८-२७||
verses.en:
naite sṛtī pārtha jānanyogī muhyati kaścana .
tasmātsarveṣu kāleṣu yogayukto bhavārjuna ..8-27..
verses.desc:
27. Knowing these paths, O Partha, no YOGIN is deluded; therefore, at all times be
steadfast in YOGA , O Arjuna.

verses.hn:
वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव
दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् |
अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा
योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ||८-२८||
verses.en:
vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva dāneṣu yatpuṇyaphalaṃ pradiṣṭam .
atyeti tatsarvamidaṃ viditvā yogī paraṃ sthānamupaiti cādyam ..8-28..
verses.desc:
28. Whether fruit of merit is declared (in the scriptures) as springing up from study of the VEDAS, from performance of sacrifices, from practice of austerities, and from charity beyond all these goes the YOGIN, who having known this (the two 'paths' ) attains to the
Supreme, Primeval (Essence).

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
अक्षरब्रह्मयोगो नामाष्टमोऽध्यायः ||८||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde akṣarabrahmayogo nāmāṣṭamo.adhyāyaḥ ..8-29..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the eightth discourse ends entitled:
THE YOGA OF IMPERISHABLE BRAHMAN.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे |
ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||९-१||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
idaṃ tu te guhyatamaṃ pravakṣyāmyanasūyave .
jñānaṃ vijñānasahitaṃ yajjñātvā mokṣyase.aśubhāt ..9-1..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
1. To you who do not cavil, I shall now declare this, the greatest secret, the most profound knowledge combined with experience (or realisation) ; which having known, you shall be free from the sorrows of life.

verses.hn:
राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् |
प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ||९-२||
verses.en:
rājavidyā rājaguhyaṃ pavitramidamuttamam .
pratyakṣāvagamaṃ dharmyaṃ susukhaṃ kartumavyayam ..9-2..
verses.desc: 2. Royal Science, Royal Secret, the supreme purifier is this, realisable by direct intuitive knowledge, according to the DHARMA, very easy to perform, imperishable.

verses.hn:
अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप |
अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ||९-३||
verses.en:
aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya parantapa .
aprāpya māṃ nivartante mṛtyusaṃsāravartmani ..9-3..
verses.desc: 3. Persons without faith in this DHARMA (the Divine Self) , O Parantapa, without attaining Me, return to the path of rebirth, fraught with death.

verses.hn:
मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना |
मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ||९-४||
verses.en:
mayā tatamidaṃ sarvaṃ jagadavyaktamūrtinā .
matsthāni sarvabhūtāni na cāhaṃ teṣvavasthitaḥ ..9-4..
verses.desc: 4. All this world is pervaded by Me in My Unmanifest form (aspect) ; all beings exist in Me, but I do not dwell in them.

verses.hn:
न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् |
भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ||९-५||
verses.en:
na ca matsthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogamaiśvaram .
bhūtabhṛnna ca bhūtastho mamātmā bhūtabhāvanaḥ ..9-5..
verses.desc:
5. Nor do beings exist (in reality) in Me --- behold My Divine YOGA supporting all
beings, but not dwelling in them, am I My Self, the 'efficient-cause' of all beings.

verses.hn:
यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् |
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ||९-६||
verses.en:
yathākāśasthito nityaṃ vāyuḥ sarvatrago mahān .
tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni matsthānītyupadhāraya ..9-6..
verses.desc:
6. As the mighty wind, moving everywhere, rests always in space (the AKASHA ) , even
so, know you, all beings rest in Me.

verses.hn:
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् |
कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ||९-७||
verses.en:
sarvabhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṃ yānti māmikām .
kalpakṣaye punastāni kalpādau visṛjāmyaham ..9-7..
verses.desc:
7. All beings, O Kaunteya (O Son of Kunti) , go into My PRAKRITI (nature) at the end of
a KALPA; I send them forth again at the beginning of (the next) KALPA.

verses.hn:
प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः |
भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ||९-८||
verses.en:
prakṛtiṃ svāmavaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ .
bhūtagrāmamimaṃ kṛtsnamavaśaṃ prakṛtervaśāt ..9-8..
verses.desc:
8. Animating My PRAKRITI, I, again and again send forth all this helpless multitude of
beings, by the force of nature (PRAKRITI) .

verses.hn:
न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय |
उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ||९-९||
verses.en:
na ca māṃ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya .
udāsīnavadāsīnamasaktaṃ teṣu karmasu ..9-9..
verses.desc:
9. Sitting like one indifferent, and unattached to these acts, Dhananjaya, these acts do
not bind Me.

verses.hn:
मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् |
हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ||९-१०||
verses.en:
mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram .
hetunānena kaunteya jagadviparivartate ..9-10..
verses.desc:
10. Under Me as her Supervisor, PRAKRITI (nature) produces the moving and the
unmoving; because of this, O Kaunteya, the world revolves.

verses.hn:
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् |
परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||९-११||
verses.en:
avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā mānuṣīṃ tanumāśritam .
paraṃ bhāvamajānanto mama bhūtamaheśvaram ..9-11..
verses.desc:
11. Fools disregard Me when I dwell in human form; they know not My Higher being as
the Great Lord of all beings.

verses.hn:
मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः |
राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ||९-१२||
verses.en:
moghāśā moghakarmāṇo moghajñānā vicetasaḥ .
rākṣasīmāsurīṃ caiva prakṛtiṃ mohinīṃ śritāḥ ..9-12..
verses.desc:
12. Of vain hopes, of vain actions, of vain knowledge, and senseless, they verily are
possessed of the delusive nature of RAKSHASAS and ASURAS.

verses.hn:
महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः |
भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ||९-१३||
verses.en:
mahātmānastu māṃ pārtha daivīṃ prakṛtimāśritāḥ .
bhajantyananyamanaso jñātvā bhūtādimavyayam ..9-13..
verses.desc:
13. But the MAHATMAS (great-souls) O Partha, partaking of My divine nature, worship
Me with a single mind (with a mind devoted to nothing else) , knowing Me as the
Imperishable Source of all beings.

verses.hn:
सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः |
नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ||९-१४||
verses.en:
satataṃ kīrtayanto māṃ yatantaśca dṛḍhavratāḥ .
namasyantaśca māṃ bhaktyā nityayuktā upāsate ..9-14..
verses.desc:
14. Always glorifying Me, striving, firm in vows, prostrating before Me, and always
steadfast, they worshipMe with devotion.

verses.hn:
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते |
एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ||९-१५||
verses.en:
jñānayajñena cāpyanye yajanto māmupāsate .
ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvatomukham ..9-15..
verses.desc:
15. Others also, offering the "Wisdom-sacrifice" worship Me, regarding Me as One, as
distinct, as manifold --- Me, who in all forms, faces everywhere.

verses.hn:
अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् |
मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ||९-१६||
verses.en:
ahaṃ kraturahaṃ yajñaḥ svadhāhamahamauṣadham .
mantro.ahamahamevājyamahamagnirahaṃ hutam ..9-16..
verses.desc:
16. I am the KRATU; I am the sacrifice; I am the offering (food) to PITRIS (or ancestors)
; I am the medicinal herb, and all plants; I am the MANTRA I am also the clarified
butter; I am the fire; I am the oblation.

verses.hn:
पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः |
वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ||९-१७||
verses.en:
pitāhamasya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ .
vedyaṃ pavitramoṃkāra ṛksāma yajureva ca ..9-17..
verses.desc:
17. I am the Father of this world, the Mother, the supporter and the grandsire; the (one)
Thing to be known, the Purifier, (the syllable) OM, and also the RIK, the SAMA and the
YAJUH also.

verses.hn:
गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् |
प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ||९-१८||
verses.en:
gatirbhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṃ suhṛt .
prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṃ nidhānaṃ bījamavyayam ..9-18..
verses.desc:
18. I am the Goal, the Supporter, the Lord, the Witness, the Abode, the Shelter, the
Friend, the Origin, the Dissolution, the Foundation, the Treasure-house and the Seed
Imperishable.

verses.hn:
तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च |
अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ||९-१९||
verses.en:
tapāmyahamahaṃ varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmyutsṛjāmi ca .
amṛtaṃ caiva mṛtyuśca sadasaccāhamarjuna ..9-19..
verses.desc:
19. (As Sun) I give heat; I withhold and send forth the rain; I am Immortality and also
death, both Existence and Non-existence, O Arjuna.

verses.hn:
त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा
यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते |
ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक-
मश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ||९-२०||
verses.en:
traividyā māṃ somapāḥ pūtapāpā yajñairiṣṭvā svargatiṃ prārthayante .
te puṇyamāsādya surendralokaṃ aśnanti divyāndivi devabhogān ..9-20..
verses.desc:
20. The Knowers of the three VEDAS, the drinkers of SOMA , purified from sin,
worshipping Me by sacrifices, pray for the way to heaven; they reach the holy world of
the Lord-of-the-gods and enjoy in heaven the Divine pleasures of the gods.

verses.hn:
ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं
क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति |
एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना
गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ||९-२१||
verses.en:
te taṃ bhuktvā svargalokaṃ viśālaṃ kṣīṇe puṇye martyalokaṃ viśanti .
evaṃ trayīdharmamanuprapannā gatāgataṃ kāmakāmā labhante ..9-21..
verses.desc:
21. They, having enjoyed the vast heaven-world, when their merits are exhausted, enter
the world-of-the-mortals; thus abiding by the injunctions of the three (VEDAS) , desiring
(objects of) desires, they attain to the state of "going-and-returning" (SAMSARA) .

verses.hn:
अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते |
तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||९-२२||
verses.en:
ananyāścintayanto māṃ ye janāḥ paryupāsate .
teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ yogakṣemaṃ vahāmyaham ..9-22..
verses.desc:
22. To those men who worship Me alone, thinking of no other, to those ever self-
controlled, I secure for them that which is not already possessed (YOGA) by them, and
preserve for them what they already possess (KSHEMA) .

verses.hn:
येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः |
तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ||९-२३||
verses.en:
ye.apyanyadevatābhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ .
te.api māmeva kaunteya yajantyavidhipūrvakam ..9-23..
verses.desc:
23. Even those devotees, who, endowed with faith worship other gods, worship Me alone,
O son of Kunti, (but) by the wrong method.

verses.hn:
अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च |
न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ||९-२४||
verses.en:
ahaṃ hi sarvayajñānāṃ bhoktā ca prabhureva ca .
na tu māmabhijānanti tattvenātaścyavanti te ..9-24..
verses.desc:
24. (For) I alone am the enjoyer in and the Lord of all sacrifices; but they do not know
Me in Essence, and hence they fall (return to this mortal world) .

verses.hn:
यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः |
भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||९-२५||
verses.en:
yānti devavratā devānpitṝnyānti pitṛvratāḥ .
bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti madyājino.api mām ..9-25..
verses.desc:
25. The worshippers of the DEVAS or gods go to the DEVAS; to the PITRIS or ancestors
go the ancestor-worshippers; to the BHUTAS or the elements go worshippers of the
BHUTAS; but My worshippers come unto Me.

verses.hn:
पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति |
तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ||९-२६||
verses.en:
patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati .
tadahaṃ bhaktyupahṛtamaśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ ..9-26..
verses.desc:
26. Whoever offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, water, that I accept, offered
by the pure-minded with devotion.

verses.hn:
यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् |
यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ||९-२७||
verses.en:
yatkaroṣi yadaśnāsi yajjuhoṣi dadāsi yat .
yattapasyasi kaunteya tatkuruṣva madarpaṇam ..9-27..
verses.desc:
27. Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you
give in charity, whatever you practise as austerity, O Kaunteya, do it as an offering to
Me.

verses.hn:
शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः |
संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ||९-२८||
verses.en:
śubhāśubhaphalairevaṃ mokṣyase karmabandhanaiḥ .
saṃnyāsayogayuktātmā vimukto māmupaiṣyasi ..9-28..

verses.hn:
समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः |
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ||९-२९||
verses.en:
samo.ahaṃ sarvabhūteṣu na me dveṣyo.asti na priyaḥ .
ye bhajanti tu māṃ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpyaham ..9-29..
verses.desc:
29. The same am I to all beings, to Me there is none hateful nor dear; but those who
worship Me with devotion, are in Me and I am also in them.

verses.hn:
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् |
साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ||९-३०||
verses.en:
api cetsudurācāro bhajate māmananyabhāk .
sādhureva sa mantavyaḥ samyagvyavasito hi saḥ ..9-30..
verses.desc:
30. Even if the most sinful worships Me, with devotion to none else, (or with single-
pointedness) , he too should indeed be regarded as 'righteous, ' for he has rightly
resolved.

verses.hn:
क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति |
कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ||९-३१||
verses.en:
kṣipraṃ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvacchāntiṃ nigacchati .
kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati ..9-31..
verses.desc:
31. Soon he becomes righteous and attains Eternal Peace, O Kaunteya, know for certain
that My devotee is never destroyed.

verses.hn:
मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः |
स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ||९-३२||
verses.en:
māṃ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye.api syuḥ pāpayonayaḥ .
striyo vaiśyāstathā śūdrāste.api yānti parāṃ gatim ..9-32..
verses.desc:
32. For, taking refuge in Me, they also, who O Partha, may be of a "sinful birth" ---
WOMEN, VAISHYAS as well as SHUDRAS --- even they attain the Supreme Goal.

verses.hn:
किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा |
अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ||९-३३||
verses.en:
kiṃ punarbrāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayastathā .
anityamasukhaṃ lokamimaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām ..9-33..
verses.desc:
33. How much more (easily) then the holy BRAHMINS, and devoted Royal saints (attain
the goal) . Having reached (obtained) this impermanent and joyless world, do worship Me
devoutly.

verses.hn:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |
मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ||९-३४||
verses.en:
manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī māṃ namaskuru .
māmevaiṣyasi yuktvaivamātmānaṃ matparāyaṇaḥ ..9-34..
verses.desc:
34. Fix your mind on Me; be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow down to Me; having
thus united your (whole) Self with Me, taking me as the Supreme Goal, you shall come to
Me.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
राजविद्याराजगुह्ययोगो नाम नवमोऽध्यायः ||९||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde rājavidyārājaguhyayogo nāma navamo.adhyāyaḥ ..9-35..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the ninth discourse ends entitled:
THE YOGA OF ROYAL KNOWLEDGE AND ROYAL SECRET

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः |
यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ||१०-१||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
bhūya eva mahābāho śṛṇu me paramaṃ vacaḥ .
yatte.ahaṃ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hitakāmyayā ..10-1..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
1. Again, O mighty-armed, listen to My Supreme word; which I, wishing our welfare, will declare to you, who delight in hearing me.

verses.hn:
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः |
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ||१०-२||
verses.en:
na me viduḥ suragaṇāḥ prabhavaṃ na maharṣayaḥ .
ahamādirhi devānāṃ maharṣīṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ ..10-2..
verses.desc: 2. Neither the hosts of heaven, nor great RISHIS know My origin; for, in every way, I am the source of all the DEVAS and the RISHIS.

verses.hn:
यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् |
असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||१०-३||
verses.en:
yo māmajamanādiṃ ca vetti lokamaheśvaram .
asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate ..10-3..
verses.desc: 3. He who amongst the mortals, knows Me as unborn and beginningless, as the great Lord of the worlds, is undeluded and is liberated from all sins.

verses.hn:
बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः |
सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ||१०-४||
verses.en:
buddhirjñānamasammohaḥ kṣamā satyaṃ damaḥ śamaḥ .
sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ bhavo.abhāvo bhayaṃ cābhayameva ca ..10-4..
verses.desc: 4. Intellect, wisdom, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, self-restraint, calmness, happiness, pain, birth or death, fear and also fearlessness, . . .

verses.hn:
अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः |
भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ||१०-५||
verses.en:
ahiṃsā samatā tuṣṭistapo dānaṃ yaśo.ayaśaḥ .
bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṃ matta eva pṛthagvidhāḥ ..10-5..
verses.desc:
5. Non-injury, equanimity, contentment, austerity, beneficence, fame, infamy --- all these
different kinds of "qualities-of-beings" arise from Me alone.

verses.hn:
महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा |
मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ||१०-६||
verses.en:
maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavastathā .
madbhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṃ loka imāḥ prajāḥ ..10-6..
verses.desc:
6. The seven great RISHIS, the ancient four and also the MANUS, possessed of powers
like Me, were born of (My) mind; from them are these creatures in the world (originated
and sustained) .

verses.hn:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः |
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ||१०-७||
verses.en:
etāṃ vibhūtiṃ yogaṃ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ .
so.avikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṃśayaḥ ..10-7..
verses.desc:
7. He, who in truth knows these manifold manifestations of My being (Macrocosm) , and
(this) YOGA -power of Mine (Microcosm) , becomes established in the "tremorless -
YOGA " ; there is no doubt about it.

verses.hn:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते |
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ||१०-८||
verses.en:
ahaṃ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṃ pravartate .
iti matvā bhajante māṃ budhā bhāvasamanvitāḥ ..10-8..
verses.desc:
8. I am the Source of All; from Me everything evolves; understanding thus, the "wise, "
endowed with 'loving consciousness' worship Me.

verses.hn:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् |
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||१०-९||
verses.en:
maccittā madgataprāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam .
kathayantaśca māṃ nityaṃ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca ..10-9..
verses.desc:
9. With their minds wholly resting in Me, with their senses absorbed in Me, enlightening
one another, and ever speaking of Me, they are satisfied and delighted.

verses.hn:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् |
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||१०-१०||
verses.en:
teṣāṃ satatayuktānāṃ bhajatāṃ prītipūrvakam .
dadāmi buddhiyogaṃ taṃ yena māmupayānti te ..10-10..
verses.desc:
10. To the ever-steadfast, worshipping Me with love, I give the "BUDDHI YOGA, " by
which they come to Me.

verses.hn:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः |
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ||१०-११||
verses.en:
teṣāmevānukampārthamahamajñānajaṃ tamaḥ .
nāśayāmyātmabhāvastho jñānadīpena bhāsvatā ..10-11..
verses.desc:
11. Out of mere compassion for them, I, dwelling within their hearts, destroy the darkness
born of ignorance by the luminous Lamp-of-Knowledge.

verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |
पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ||१०-१२||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
paraṃ brahma paraṃ dhāma pavitraṃ paramaṃ bhavān .
puruṣaṃ śāśvataṃ divyamādidevamajaṃ vibhum ..10-12..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
12. You are the Supreme BRAHMAN, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Purifier, Eternal,
Divine PURUSHA, the God of all gods, Unborn, Omnipresent.

verses.hn:
आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा |
असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||१०-१३||
verses.en:
āhustvāmṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣirnāradastathā .
asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṃ caiva bravīṣi me ..10-13..
verses.desc:
13. All the RISHIS have thus declared You, as also the DEVA-RISHI Narada, so also
Asita, Devala and Vyasa; and now the same You Yourself say to me.

verses.hn:
सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव |
न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ||१०-१४||
verses.en:
sarvametadṛtaṃ manye yanmāṃ vadasi keśava .
na hi te bhagavanvyaktiṃ vidurdevā na dānavāḥ ..10-14..
verses.desc:
14. I believe all this that You say to me as true, O Keshava; verily, O Blessed Lord,
neither the DEVAS nor the DANAVAS know Your manifestation (identity) .

verses.hn:
स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम |
भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ||१०-१५||
verses.en:
svayamevātmanātmānaṃ vettha tvaṃ puruṣottama .
bhūtabhāvana bhūteśa devadeva jagatpate ..10-15..
verses.desc:
15. Verily, You Yourself know Yourself by Yourself, O PURUSHOTTAMA (Supreme
PURUSHA) , O Source of beings, O Lord of beings, O God of gods, O Ruler of the world.

verses.hn:
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः |
याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ||१०-१६||
verses.en:
vaktumarhasyaśeṣeṇa divyā hyātmavibhūtayaḥ .
yābhirvibhūtibhirlokānimāṃstvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi ..10-16..
verses.desc:
16. You should indeed, without reserve, tell me of Your Divine glories by which You exist
pervading all these worlds.

verses.hn:
कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् |
केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||१०-१७||
verses.en:
kathaṃ vidyāmahaṃ yogiṃstvāṃ sadā paricintayan .
keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo.asi bhagavanmayā ..10-17..
verses.desc:
17. How shall I, ever-meditating, know You, O YOGIN? In what aspects or things, O
Blessed Lord, are You to be thought of by me?

verses.hn:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन |
भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||१०-१८||
verses.en:
vistareṇātmano yogaṃ vibhūtiṃ ca janārdana .
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptirhi śṛṇvato nāsti me.amṛtam ..10-18..
verses.desc:
18. Tell me again, in detail, O Janardana, of your YOGA -power and Immanent glory;
for I do not feel satisfied by hearing your (life-giving and so) nectar-like speech.

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः |
प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ||१०-१९||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hyātmavibhūtayaḥ .
prādhānyataḥ kuruśreṣṭha nāstyanto vistarasya me ..10-19..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
19. Alas! Now I will declare to you My Divine glories, immanent, in their prominence; O
best of the Kurus, there is no end to the details of My extent.

verses.hn:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः |
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||१०-२०||
verses.en:
ahamātmā guḍākeśa sarvabhūtāśayasthitaḥ .
ahamādiśca madhyaṃ ca bhūtānāmanta eva ca ..10-20..
verses.desc:
20. I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all beings; I am the Beginning, the
Middle and also the End of all beings.

verses.hn:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् |
मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ||१०-२१||
verses.en:
ādityānāmahaṃ viṣṇurjyotiṣāṃ raviraṃśumān .
marīcirmarutāmasmi nakṣatrāṇāmahaṃ śaśī ..10-21..
verses.desc:
21. Among the (twelve) ADITYAS I am Vishnu; among luminaries, the radiant Sun; I am
Marichi among the MARUTS; among asterisms, the moon am I.

verses.hn:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः |
इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ||१०-२२||
verses.en:
vedānāṃ sāmavedo.asmi devānāmasmi vāsavaḥ .
indriyāṇāṃ manaścāsmi bhūtānāmasmi cetanā ..10-22..
verses.desc:
22. Among the VEDAS, I am the SAMA-VEDA; I am VASAVA among the gods; among
the senses I am the mind; and I am the intelligence among living beings.

verses.hn:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् |
वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ||१०-२३||
verses.en:
rudrāṇāṃ śaṅkaraścāsmi vitteśo yakṣarakṣasām .
vasūnāṃ pāvakaścāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇāmaham ..10-23..
verses.desc:
23. And among the RUDRAS I am Shankara; among the YAKSHAS and RAKSHASAS I
am the Lord of wealth (KUBERA) ; among the VASUS I am PAVAKA (AGNI) ; and
among the mountains I am the MERU.

verses.hn:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् |
सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ||१०-२४||
verses.en:
purodhasāṃ ca mukhyaṃ māṃ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim .
senānīnāmahaṃ skandaḥ sarasāmasmi sāgaraḥ ..10-24..
verses.desc:
24. And among the household priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief, BRIHASPATI;
among generals, I am SKANDA; among lakes, I am the ocean.

verses.hn:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् |
यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ||१०-२५||
verses.en:
maharṣīṇāṃ bhṛgurahaṃ girāmasmyekamakṣaram .
yajñānāṃ japayajño.asmi sthāvarāṇāṃ himālayaḥ ..10-25..

verses.hn:
अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः |
गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ||१०-२६||
verses.en:
aśvatthaḥ sarvavṛkṣāṇāṃ devarṣīṇāṃ ca nāradaḥ .
gandharvāṇāṃ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṃ kapilo muniḥ ..10-26..
verses.desc:
26. Among all trees (I am) the ASHWATTHA -tree; among Divine RISHIS , Narada ;
among GANDHARVAS , Chitraratha ; among Perfected ones , the MUNI Kapila .

verses.hn:
उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् |
ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ||१०-२७||
verses.en:
uccaiḥśravasamaśvānāṃ viddhi māmamṛtodbhavam .
airāvataṃ gajendrāṇāṃ narāṇāṃ ca narādhipam ..10-27..
verses.desc:
27. Know Me among horses as 'UCCHAHI-SHRAVAS', born of AMRITA; among lordly
elephants, the 'AIRAVATA' and among men, the King.

verses.hn:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् |
प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ||१०-२८||
verses.en:
āyudhānāmahaṃ vajraṃ dhenūnāmasmi kāmadhuk .
prajanaścāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇāmasmi vāsukiḥ ..10-28..
